chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: In today's video, I will tell you about specificity in CSS.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Assume you have an element that has been styled in two ways through CSS.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That means we have used two types of selectors to style it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And both styles are saying two different things.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Let's say one style is saying make the background color red.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And the other style is saying make the background color yellow.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Which one will be applied?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: This thing will be determined with the help of specificity in CSS.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: In this video, I will tell you all the rules.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: How does specificity work in CSS?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Do write Sigma Batch OP in the comments below.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Let's go to the computer screen and let's roll the intro.

chunks.text: Intro

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I have entered my computer screen.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And today's video is going to be important because in today's video, I am going to tell you

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: how to decide which of the conflicted classes or conflicting property value pairs will be applied in CSS.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will quickly create a folder named video 21 and open it in my VS Code.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will create an index.html and start this video with a question.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: The question I am going to ask you is that, let's say you have a div in it.

chunks.text: You have this h1 and it is written in this h1.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I accidentally pressed ctrl s.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Specificity is written here.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I have added two classes.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Let's say yellow, c red and c purple.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I have added three classes.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now I will put the style here and I will say that the color of h1 is red.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Or do aqua.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And after this, I say that the yellow is our class.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Dot yellow.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Color it according to that.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And along with that, the c red class is our color red and along with that, the c purple is our dot c purple.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: According to that, the color is purple.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So I put it here and I will click here to show you that its color is purple.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: On what basis was the purple color applied?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I mean, why didn't it turn yellow?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Because I gave the color aqua in h1.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I gave the color according to the yellow.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then I gave the color according to c red.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Was the purple because it was below?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Or did the purple look like this class?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I mean, on what basis do things decide in CSS?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will tell you this today.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: See, if I put h1 below and now I show you, then the color is purple.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So what is it that is deciding which color, which conflicting property will be applied?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So here I want to tell you that there is an algorithm in CSS called Cascade algorithm.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and to resolve any kind of conflict, Cascade algorithm is used in CSS.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: This algorithm determines which property will be applied in CSS and which will not be done.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now look here, we have applied a lot of color properties in the same element in different ways.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Which property will win here?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Which property will be the winning property?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: This Cascade algorithm determines.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So there are four rules in Cascade algorithm at a very high level.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: The first rule says that the position and order of appearance are important.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If you have kept the position of anything later, then that property will be applied.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: For example, here you saw that the h1, I had kept h1 above.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And you saw that the dot c purple was applied.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If I put the dot c red later, then it will be applied.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That is, they are using the class selector and these three are using the class selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So these three are equal in a way.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So even after using the class selector, the one that is the lowest,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That is, the one that is overwritten in the programming languages,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Similarly, this can also be overwritten if there is the same type of selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then look here, if c is red, then the color will be red here.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: C will be red later.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: But where the way of the selector changes, then the specificity is used.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now what is this specificity?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Specificity is calculated for a particular selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will tell you this.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So let's understand the position and order of appearance first.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: What is the effect of position?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If you are using the same selector, for example, you are using the element selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And you are using only the class selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So whatever will happen later will win.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose I am not using this, I will comment it out.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So the one that will win from the dot yellow, dot c purple and dot c red,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If I do the dot yellow later, then it will win.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That is, if the selector is of the same type,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Like class selector, id selector or any other,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Means all three are the same type of selectors,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So the conflict will be resolved in all three.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Which is later, so you saw here that the one that was later won.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Here it became yellow because yellow was later.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: But where we change the selector,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose I make it id selector or I make it element selector like h1.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So here we use specificity.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now this specificity will be calculated.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: What is specificity?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will tell you what is specificity.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Specificity is basically calculated as a value.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Specificity says which CSS selector is the most specific.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Like here I show you,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So the id selector is considered the most specific.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: But more specific than that is the inline style.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That is, if you have put inline style,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That is, if you write anything by doing style is equal to,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then it will be considered as a mantra through that tag.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Like I tell you that if I write style is equal to color blue.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So the thing is over.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Style attribute is the most priority in specificity.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So it will not even see what you have written in CSS about color.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Color will apply blue directly as you can see here.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now if I show you here,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If I remove this now, then the matter will come again on specificity.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Which is the most specific selector?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: All specificity will be calculated.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now how to calculate specificity?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will show you.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If you have very simple selectors like inline style,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: It is given the most priority.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: After this comes the id selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If anything has been selected from id,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: It is the most specific.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: That is, if you have put styles in id,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then they will be applicable.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: More than if you have put in class or you have used an attribute selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: What is attribute selector?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will tell you what attribute selector is.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose I have here,

chunks.text: Let's say,

chunks.text: Area,

chunks.text: Data x is equal to 1.

chunks.text: Or data x is equal to a.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So I can say that where

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: What will I say?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So this is attribute selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I am saying that the element in which data x

chunks.text: Value is a.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: This is attribute selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I was telling you what attribute selector is.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So the most specific will be inline styles.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: After that will be id selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: After that will be class or attribute selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then element selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then universal selector, which is star.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So you will always try to

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Use the least specific selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Why? Because it will be easy to overwrite.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Like let's say I have written any style

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Using universal selector.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now I am in the mood to overwrite it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So I will use element selector to overwrite it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I feel like overwriting it too.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So what did I do? I used class or attribute selector

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And overwrote it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I feel like overwriting it too.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I used id selector to overwrite it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: But where I used inline style,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: It will be difficult to overwrite it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So this thing gives a little problem.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So here you see

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: The position matters.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If there is only one type of selector,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: The selector is exactly the same.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Specificity is exactly the same.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So you will see the position.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: The most later will be applicable.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will also teach you to calculate specificity.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Exact value.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: But I told you at a high level that

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Inline styles are their priority.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: After that, if you have used id selector,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then priority will be given to it.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then comes origin.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: The order in which CSS appears

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: And where it comes from.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Now here origin is very important.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Because

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: If your CSS

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Is coming from your browser style.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Because if you have not put CSS in any element,

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Then it is your browser's

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Style sheet.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Which is called user agent style sheet.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So here if I right click and

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: Inspect and show you.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So let's say I show this effect of position heading.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So here some styles are coming from the user agent style sheet.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: I will show you here.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: User agent style sheet.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: This means that this browser has put it on its own.

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: So where is it coming from?

chunks.title: CSS Specificity & Cascade  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #21.mp4
chunks.text: What is its priority?
